title: Ginger-Scallion Sauce
source: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
categories: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
directions: 1. Combine scallions, ginger, and salt in a heatproof bowl.
2. Heat oil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat until it reaches 400°F.
3. Pour hot oil over scallion mixture (oil will crackle), and stir to combine.
4. Stir in vinegar and let sit for at least 15 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
5. (Sauce can be refrigerated for up to 4 days; let come to room temperature before serving.)
